TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi RibbonTextBox extends System.Windows.Controls.TextBox implements class System.Windows.Input.ICommandSource
Public Class RibbonTextBox Inherits TextBox Implements ICommandSource
public ref class RibbonTextBox : System::Windows::Controls::TextBox, System::Windows::Input::ICommandSource
type RibbonTextBox = class inherit TextBox interface ICommandSource

Docs.summary: Represents a text box that is used in a control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The following illustration shows examples of <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonTextBox> controls in large, medium, and small variations, and with no images.
![Ribbon text box controls](~/add/media/wpfribbon-textbox.png "Ribbon text box controls") Ribbon text box controls
## Examples The following example shows the markup to create a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonTextBox> control with a large image, a small image, and a label.
[!code-xaml[Ribbon_ControlsSample#RibbonTextBox](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/ribbon_controlssample/cs/mainwindow.xaml#ribbontextbox)]

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ KeyTip { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.KeyTip : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the keyboard shortcut for the control.
Docs.value: The keyboard shortcut for the control. The registered default is . For more information about what can influence the value, see [Dependency Property Value Precedence](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/dependency-property-value-precedence.md).

remarks.format: ## Remarks A KeyTip must be from 1 to 3 uppercase characters, and must not contain spaces, tabs, or newline characters. KeyTips are sometimes known as access keys or accelerators and are used as shortcut key combinations that activate controls. KeyTips appear on the Ribbon when you press the ALT key. ## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None|

Docs.summary: Builds the visual tree for the when a new template is applied.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method is invoked whenever application code or an internal process, such as a rebuilding layout pass, calls the <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.ApplyTemplate%2A> method.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance void OnGotKeyboardFocus(class System.Windows.Input.KeyboardFocusChangedEventArgs e) cil managed
Protected Overrides Sub OnGotKeyboardFocus (e As KeyboardFocusChangedEventArgs)

Docs.summary: Provides class handling for the event and enables the keyboard focus visual when this control gets keyboard focus.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method overrides the default behavior and enables the keyboard focus visual when this control gets keyboard focus.
This implementation does not change the handled state (the <xref:System.Windows.RoutedEventArgs.Handled%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> property) of the <xref:System.Windows.UIElement.GotKeyboardFocus> event data.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance void OnLostKeyboardFocus(class System.Windows.Input.KeyboardFocusChangedEventArgs e) cil managed
Protected Overrides Sub OnLostKeyboardFocus (e As KeyboardFocusChangedEventArgs)

Docs.summary: Provides class handling for the event and disables the keyboard focus visual when this control loses keyboard focus.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method overrides the default behavior and disables the keyboard focus visual when this control loses keyboard focus.
This implementation does not change the handled state (the <xref:System.Windows.RoutedEventArgs.Handled%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> property) of the <xref:System.Windows.UIElement.LostKeyboardFocus> event data.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the descriptive text that is displayed in the ToolTip for this control.

remarks.format: ## Remarks > [!WARNING] > Each ribbon control inherits a property. If the property is set, the ribbon's enhanced ToolTip will not be shown; the standard ToolTip will be shown instead. ## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None| ## Examples The following example shows the markup used to create the enhanced ToolTip. ![Enhanced ToolTip](~/add/media/wpfribbon-tooltipenhanced.png "Enhanced ToolTip") Enhanced ToolTip [!code-xaml[Ribbon_ControlsSample#RibbonTextBoxTT](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/ribbon_controlssample/cs/mainwindow.xaml#ribbontextboxtt)]

Docs.value: The title text to display in the ToolTip. The registered default is . For more information about what can influence the value, see [Dependency Property Value Precedence](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/dependency-property-value-precedence.md).

remarks.format: ## Remarks > [!WARNING] > Each ribbon control inherits a property. If the property is set, the ribbon's enhanced ToolTip will not be shown; the standard ToolTip will be shown instead. ## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None| ## Examples The following example shows the markup used to create the enhanced ToolTip. ![Enhanced ToolTip](~/add/media/wpfribbon-tooltipenhanced.png "Enhanced ToolTip") Enhanced ToolTip [!code-xaml[Ribbon_ControlsSample#RibbonTextBoxTT](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/ribbon_controlssample/cs/mainwindow.xaml#ribbontextboxtt)]

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class System.Windows.DependencyProperty ToolTipTitleProperty
Public Shared ReadOnly ToolTipTitleProperty As DependencyProperty

Docs.summary: Identifies the dependency property.
